definitions.definition: To perceive visually through something transparent.
definitions.example: Their fabric is so thin that I can see through these curtains.

definitions.definition: To not be deceived by something that is false or misleading; to understand the hidden truth about someone or something.
definitions.example: I can see through his poker face, he isn't fooling anyone.

definitions.definition: To recognize someone's true motives or character.
definitions.example: In that moment, I saw right through her; this petition drive had nothing to do with her love for animals, and everything to do with impressing Michael, the cute intern.

definitions.definition: To provide support or cooperation to (a person) throughout a period of time; to support someone through a difficult time.
definitions.example: And may we all, citizens the world over, see these events through.

definitions.definition: To do something until it is finished; to continue working on (something) until it is finished.
definitions.example: Despite her health problems, Madame Prime Minister saw the project through.

definitions.definition: To constitute ample supply for one for.
definitions.example: Those chocolates should see us through the holiday season.
